com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class GroupSymbol

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseSymbol
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.GroupSymbol
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Symbol
public class GroupSymbol
extends BaseSymbol

A GroupSymbol is an ordered collection of Symbols.

The order of the collection determines a draw order of a Feature's Geometry. The first symbol in the collection will be used to draw the Feature first, therefore is shown underneath all other symbols. The last symbol in the collection is drawn last, and thus appears on top of all other symbols.

Each Symbol can be identified by either itself (a Symbol reference) or by the Symbol index which is the Symbol's index location within the the ordered collection.

See Also:
Display

draw

public void draw(FeatureGeometry g,
                 Graphics2D g2,
                 Object values)
This method will draw the given geometry by passing it in turn to the draw method of each of the Symbols in the collection.

Parameters:

g2 - is Graphics2D context
